Message:
I quickly head to the city square
and see traveling acrobats
putting on a show.

Watching them were children
with bright smiles on their faces.

Then, as I was about to ask
the acrobats if I could join them,
something happened.

“Enough with the noise.
This is a ritual ceremony,
damn sinners.”

When that elderly man came
out of the crowd and said that,

the music came to
a complete stop,

and the smiles disappeared
from the children’s faces.

Wait, didn’t Vera say
something about this?

I think she said,
while this event’s more like
a music festival nowadays,

one of the elderly thinks otherwise,
and causes an uproar every year.

And, the ritual ceremony should
be held quietly to mourn the dead,

so making noise will incur
the wrath of the dead,
or something...

“It’s absolutely ridiculous
how vulgar acrobatics are.
Get that filth out of my city!”

After saying that,
the elderly man swung
his cane around,

causing everyone around him
to clear out and leave.
